title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Frederick S. Tukey to Orlando Brown, February 9, 1867
summary: Tukey submits additional statemtents on his behalf to General Brown. Tukey also draws attention to a preacher who worked in Staunton during his tenure, now living in Richmond, with whom he hopes General Brown will meet.
keywords: Adminstration/Bureaucracy, Patriotism, Church/Religious Activity, Politics/Political Attitudes, American Civil War
